column1: The Ivy Bush was an inn located on Bywater Road in the Shire.

The Ivy Bush was frequented by the Hobbits of Hobbiton and Bywater. It was here that Gaffer Gamgee got quite an audience who were interested in the stories he told about  Bilbo Baggins and Frodo Baggins.
The Ivy Bush is the name of a public house located on Hagley Road
column4: "http://wulfwaru.wordpress.com/2008/09/06/its-official-hobbiton-is-really-birmingham/ It’s official – Hobbiton is really… Birmingham?!"
column7: 2008 When J.R.R. Tolkien lived on Stirling Road this would have been his local hostelry and could be found halfway between his house and the Birmingham Oratory
column8: where he worshiped for a time.

column1: 2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game):
:The Ivy Bush is a two-story building located at Bywaters market. Unlike the Green Dragon
column2: which is on the other side of the market
column3: the Ivy Bush plays no part in the story.
